items.title: Live: Out-of-control bushfires burning in Victoria as Australia braces for more heat
items.description: Authorities are continuing to battle out-of-control bushfires across Victoria, which have already claimed dozens of properties. Meanwhile, extreme heatwave warnings remain in place for NSW, ACT and WA. Follow live.

items.title: Tropical Cyclone Koji expected to make landfall within hours
items.description: Tropical Cyclone Koji is expected to make landfall between Ayr and Bowen, according to the weather bureau.

items.title: Track Tropical Cyclone Koji live as it approaches Australia's coastline
items.description: Track the path of Tropical Cyclone Koji and monitor wind speeds as the system moves towards the coast.

items.title: 'Only thing missing is my eight-year-old daughter': Father's chilling report
items.description: Fifty years after Beaumaris schoolgirl Eloise Worledge vanished, could new leads solve one of Australia's most haunting cold cases?

items.title: Has Trump landed a dud with his Venezuelan oil play?
items.description: While debate rages over the legality and the potential fallout from America's incursion, there's been a quiet acceptance that it is all about oil.

items.title: The rhetoric of the Trump administration has taken a chilling turn
items.description: There have been plenty of examples of the Trump administration's contempt for legalities, diplomacy and alliances, but this week Trump and his lieutenants went further.

items.title: Six dead, including a child, in Mississippi shootings, suspect charged
items.description: A man is charged with murder after six people from the same family were killed in a series of shootings.

items.title: Christian sect investigated by the FBI under pressure to reveal wealth
items.description: Survivors of a secretive Christian sect, under investigation by the FBI, say it is hiding wealth through trusts, blocking access to abuse compensation.

items.title: The ABC was granted access to Afghanistan. This is what we saw
items.description: Four years after the Taliban's return to power, security is no longer the defining issue in Afghanistan. Instead, one of the world's worst humanitarian crises is exacerbated by a series of overlapping disasters.

items.title: Arsenal shows support for Cooney-Cross in wake of mother's cancer diagnosis
items.description: Arsenal players and supporters pay emotional tributes to Matildas star Kyra Cooney-Cross following her return to Australia to be with her mother, who has been diagnosed with cancer.

items.title: Khawaja stars as Heat thrash Thunder, Warner injured
items.description: Usman Khawaja's international career may be over, but he showed he is far from a spent force by stroking a fine 78 to help the Brisbane Heat to a BBL victory.

items.title: Ukrainian underdog sets up Sabalenka final with 55-minute annihilation
items.description: Marta Kostyuk crushed world number six Jessica Pegula in less than an hour after Aryna Sabalenka powered past Karolína Muchová to reach a third consecutive Brisbane International final.

items.title: Gauff beats Świątek but Poland advances to United Cup final
items.description: Coco Gauff gets on top of Iga Świątek ahead of the Australian Open, but the US star fails to stop Poland from reaching the United Cup final in Sydney.

items.title: The 'Barbie nose' is everywhere. It has some experts concerned
items.description: Tiny, sloped rhinoplasties are dominating pop culture. But some plastic surgery experts say "trend-associated" procedures like these are a concern.

items.title: Challenges faced by police in hunt for alleged Mullewa gunman
items.description: A search and rescue specialist details the significant hurdles faced by police as the manhunt for an alleged gunman in Western Australia's Midwest enters its fifth day.

items.title: 'Significant' impact for community bands as funding applications rejected
items.description: Wollongong’s collective of brass and wind bands have been putting on a show for locals for almost a century, but it is one of dozens of community bands across the state that faces an uncertain future due to a recent loss of funding.

items.title: 1986 in music: The big albums turning 40 this year
items.description: Pop and MTV ruled supreme but 1986 was also a banner year for hip hop and metal.

items.title: Mystery grips village after 'priceless' trophy fleeced from museum
items.description: For years, a prestigious trophy that represented Australia's ties to Italian high fashion took pride of place in a Tasmanian museum. But it is now missing after a 'targeted' overnight robbery.

items.title: Wetland teeming with life in this remote Corner Country of NSW
items.description: In a remote and isolated part of NSW, nature is enjoying a deluge of water still around from floods in Queensland last year.

items.title: A Tasmanian council built a wall. It hasn't gone down well
items.description: A concrete wall built on the picturesque waterfront of a small Tasmanian town has prompted confusion and concern from residents.

items.title: Former Adelaide Festival leaders label Palestinian author's exclusion 'grave mistake'
items.description: Nearly a dozen former leaders of the Adelaide Festival are calling for Randa Abdel-Fattah to be reinvited to Writers' Week, adding to a mounting crisis over the Palestinian-Australian author's exclusion from the literary festival.

items.title: From sermons to guitar solos: Indonesian priest's unlikely pulpit is rock'n'roll
items.description: The Indonesian priest brings a deep love of rock'n'roll to his pastoral care in western NSW.

items.title: Aussie bobsleigh star Walker claims historic win ahead of Winter Olympics
items.description: With the Winter Olympics on the horizon, Bree Walker proves she is among the medal favourites in the monobob with a World Cup victory in Switzerland.

items.title: Is spin bowling a dying art in Australian cricket?
items.description: After an Ashes series dominated by pace bowlers, what does the future hold for young spinners wanting to play Test cricket for Australia?

items.title: New video emerges of ICE agent shooting woman in Minneapolis
items.description: The new footage, reposted by the White House on social media, was recorded by the agent involved, and reveals the confrontation that led to the shooting as well as him swearing at her immediately afterwards.
